query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Già era ’l sole a l’orizzonte giunto 2 lo cui meridïan cerchio coverchia 3 Ierusalèm col suo più alto punto;
query.error: **English:** 1 Now the sun had reached the horizon, 2 whose meridian circle covers 3 Jerusalem with its highest point;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e la notte, che opposita a lui cerchia, 5 uscia di Gange fuor con le Bilance, 6 che le caggion di man quando soverchia;
query.error: **English:** 4 and night, which circles opposite to it, 5 was emerging from the Ganges with Libra, 6 which falls from its hands when it is outweighed;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 sì che le bianche e le vermiglie guance, 8 là dov’ i’ era, de la bella Aurora 9 per troppa etate divenivan rance.
query.error: **English:** 7 so that the white and rosy cheeks, 8 where I was, of beautiful Dawn 9 were becoming pale with excessive age.
query.result: 7 marow an gwynn ha'n rudh, 8 le mayth ow tos ow tos, a'n Vorow Gwyls, 9 ow tos ow tos ow tos ow tos ow tos ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Noi eravam lunghesso mare ancora, 11 come gente che pensa a suo cammino, 12 che va col cuore e col corpo dimora.
query.error: **English:** 10 We were still walking along the seashore, 11 like people who are thinking about their journey, 12 who go forward in heart but linger in body.
query.result: 10 Ni a veu hedrevek orth an mor, 11 kepar den a wra'n ow tos orth y'n fordh, 12 ow tos orth gans y'n colon ha'n korf ow tos ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Ed ecco, qual, sorpreso dal mattino, 14 per li grossi vapor Marte rosseggia 15 giù nel ponente sovra ’l suol marino,
query.error: **English:** 13 And behold, like Mars, surprised by the morning, 14 reddens through the thick vapors 15 down in the west over the sea floor,
query.result: 13 Ha'n rak, kepar, ow tos ow tos orth an myttyn, 14 orth an moylow tew, Marte ow tos ow tos ow tos, 15 orth an west orth an mor,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 cotal m’apparve, s’io ancor lo veggia, 17 un lume per lo mar venir sì ratto, 18 che ’l muover suo nessun volar pareggia.
query.error: **English:** 16 so appeared to me, if I still see it, 17 a light coming across the sea so swiftly 18 that no flight can match its motion.
query.result: 16 marow ow tos ow tos orth vy, pan ow'm ow tos ow tos ow tos, 17 golow orth an mor ow tos ow tos ow tos, 18 le mayth y'n fordh nyns ow tos ow tos ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Dal qual com’ io un poco ebbi ritratto 20 l’occhio per domandar lo duca mio, 21 rividil più lucente e maggior fatto.
query.error: **English:** 19 From which, when I had withdrawn my eyes for a moment 20 to ask my guide, 21 I saw it again, brighter and larger.
query.result: 19 Orth an moylow ow tos ow tos ow tos, 20 ow'm a wrug vy lagha orth vy arlodh, 21 ow'm a'gas ow tos ow tos ow tos ha moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Poi d’ogne lato ad esso m’appario 23 un non sapeva che bianco, e di sotto 24 a poco a poco un altro a lui uscìo.
query.error: **English:** 22 Then on each side of it there appeared to me 23 one I did not know, who was white, and from below 24 little by little another came out to him.
query.result: 22 Wosa dhe bub tu dhe'm hwelas 23 unn na wodhev nebes, ha gwyn, ha a-woles 24 bys vyk bys vyk unn aral dhe'n kerghynas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Lo mio maestro ancor non facea motto, 26 mentre che i primi bianchi apparver ali; 27 allor che ben conobbe il galeotto,
query.error: **English:** 25 My master still did not speak, 26 while the first white ones appeared with wings; 27 then he recognized the ferryman well,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 gridò: «Fa, fa che le ginocchia cali. 29 Ecco l’angel di Dio: piega le mani; 30 omai vedrai di sì fatti officiali.
query.error: **English:** 28 he cried: "Make, make your knees bend. 29 Behold the angel of God: fold your hands; 30 now you will see such officials.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Vedi che sdegna li argomenti umani, 32 sì che remo non vuol, né altro velo 33 che l’ali sue, tra liti sì lontani.
query.error: **English:** 31 See how he disdains human arguments, 32 so that he wants no oar, nor other sail 33 than his own wings, between such distant shores.
query.result: 31 Gwels dha'n disdeyn an arethow dyn, 32 ytho na vyn rewl, na aral wel 33 mes y eliow, ynter lityow avel hyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Vedi come l’ha dritte verso ’l cielo, 35 trattando l’aere con l’etterne penne, 36 che non si mutan come mortal pelo».
query.error: **English:** 34 See how she has her back turned towards heaven, 35 beating the air with her eternal wings, 36 that do not change like mortal hair.
query.result: 34 Gweles vy pyth yw hy dhreuth vers an nef, 35 ow treylya an ayr gans hy pluvennow bys vyth, 36 na wra chanjya kepar blew mortal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Poi, come più e più verso noi venne 38 l’uccel divino, più chiaro appariva: 39 per che l’occhio da presso nol sostenne,
query.error: **English:** 37 Then, as more and more the divine air came, 38 it appeared clearer: 39 because the eye was not harmed by it,
query.result: 37 Wosa, kepar ha moy ha moy a dheuth 38 an el dhewin, moyha moy a wra gwelys: 39 rag na wra an golg devedhys gans an golys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 ma chinail giuso; e quei sen venne a riva 41 con un vasello snelletto e leggero, 42 tanto che l’acqua nulla ne ’nghiottiva.
query.error: **English:** 40 but I lowered my gaze; and he came to the shore 41 with a swift and light vessel, 42 so that the water did not ripple at all.
query.result: 40 mes y’m golg dhe’n; ha henna dheuth dhe’n glann 41 gans on vas gladh ha skwych ha dowr, 42 kepar na wra an dowr ow rimpla dhodho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Da poppa stava il celestial nocchiero, 44 tal che faria beato pur descripto; 45 e più di cento spirti entro sediero.
query.error: **English:** 43 At the stern stood the celestial helmsman, 44 such that to describe him would make one blessed; 45 and more than a hundred spirits sat within.
query.result: 43 Yn puppa o sevel an nogher nevek, 44 kepar hag a wra gwella bewnans pur dres, 45 ha moy ages spyrys a sevel y’n mes.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 ‘In exitu Isräel de Aegypto’ 47 cantavan tutti insieme ad una voce 48 con quanto di quel salmo è poscia scripto.
query.error: **English:** 46 ‘When Israel went out of Egypt’ 47 they all sang together in one voice 48 with as much of that psalm as is written afterwards.
query.result: 46 ‘Yn exitu Israel de Aegypto’ 47 a gana totholl gans unn lagasow 48 gans an moy a’n salm na yw skrifys wosa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Poi fece il segno lor di santa croce; 50 ond’ ei si gittar tutti in su la piaggia: 51 ed el sen gì, come venne, veloce.
query.error: **English:** 49 Then he made the sign of the holy cross to them; 50 whereupon they all threw themselves down on the shore: 51 and he went away, as he had come, swiftly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 La turba che rimase lì, selvaggia 53 parea del loco, rimirando intorno 54 come colui che nove cose assaggia.
query.error: **English:** 52 The crowd that remained there, wild, 53 seemed bewildered, looking around 54 like one who tastes new things.
query.result: 52 An bobel a veu lefvys ena, gwyls, 53 a leveris marow, ow tos ow holya 54 kepar ha neb a wra provia traow nowydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Da tutte parti saettava il giorno 56 lo sol, ch’avea con le saette conte 57 di mezzo ’l ciel cacciato Capricorno,
query.error: **English:** 55 From one side the sun was shooting its 56 rays, which with its arrows had 57 driven out Capricorn.
query.result: 55 Uga'n tu a dhesevis an 56 heul, a veu gans y sel 57 ow chasya an Gavricarn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 quando la nova gente alzò la fronte 59 ver’ noi, dicendo a noi: «Se voi sapete, 60 mostratene la via di gire al monte».
query.error: **English:** 58 when the new people raised their faces 59 towards us, saying to us: "If you know, 60 show us the way to go to the mountain".
query.result: 58 pan wrug an dus nowyth sevel aga fenester 59 orthyn ni, ow leverel dhyn: "Mar wyth ow tos, 60 diskwedh dhyn an fordh dhe'n menydh".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 E Virgilio rispuose: «Voi credete 62 forse che siamo esperti d’esto loco; 63 ma noi siam peregrin come voi siete.
query.error: **English:** 61 And Virgil replied: "You perhaps believe 62 that we are experts in this place; 63 but we are pilgrims just like you."
query.result: 61 Ha Virjili a rebegas: "Hwi a grys 62 mar nyns yw niver a-dro dhe'n le ma, 63 mes ny yw niver pererin avelowhwi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Dianzi venimmo, innanzi a voi un poco, 65 per altra via, che fu sì aspra e forte, 66 che lo salire omai ne parrà gioco».
query.error: **English:** 64 We came here a short while ago, before you, 65 by another way, which was so rough and difficult, 66 that the climb up now will seem like child's play."
query.result: 64 Nyns yw niver deuedhys, kyns dedhuchwi un tamm, 65 a-hys dhe fordh arall, o a veu kemmys kalet ha fethys, 66 bys dhe'n fordh dhe'n ughella bythkweth avel gwari."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 L’anime, che si fuor di me accorte, 68 per lo spirare, ch’i’ era ancor vivo, 69 maravigliando diventaro smorte.
query.error: **English:** 67 The spirits, who had noticed that I was alive, 68 because of my breathing, 69 were amazed and turned pale.
query.result: 67 An enevalow, a veu gweles ow byw, 68 dre'n eneval, ow kovsa byw, 69 a veu kevys ha troha pale.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 70 Ha vel kevel a-dhorrhes olive, 71 a wra dhe dus dhe glywes nowethow, 72 ha neb a-dhismygi dhe'n fordh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 così al viso mio s’affisar quelle 74 anime fortunate tutte quante, 75 quasi oblïando d’ire a farsi belle.
query.error: **English:** 73 so those fortunate spirits all fixed their gaze 74 on my face, 75 almost forgetting to go and make themselves beautiful.
query.result: 73 kevel dhe'm fas a veu dhe enevalow 74 oll an enevalow fortunys, 75 a-gas dhe'n fordh dhe wul dhe'n golonsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Io vidi una di lor trarresi avante 77 per abbracciarmi con sì grande affetto, 78 che mosse me a far lo somigliante.
query.error: **English:** 76 I saw one of them step forward 77 to embrace me with such great affection, 78 that it moved me to do the same.
query.result: 76 Me a welas onen a-dheuth dhe'm ragdres 77 dhe'm golghi gans dhe'n kalon affection, 78 ow a veu ow movia dhe wul an keth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Ohi ombre vane, fuor che ne l’aspetto! 80 tre volte dietro a lei le mani avvinsi, 81 e tante mi tornai con esse al petto.
query.error: **English:** 79 Oh, empty shades, except in appearance! 80 Three times I clasped my hands behind her, 81 and as many times they returned to my chest.
query.result: 79 Oh, enevalow gwag, mes y'n aga! 80 Tri gweyth y'm golgas ow dhewol dhe'y golon, 81 ha tri gweyth y'm deuthas dhe'm golon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Di maraviglia, credo, mi dipinsi; 83 per che l’ombra sorrise e si ritrasse, 84 e io, seguendo lei, oltre mi pinsi.
query.error: **English:** 82 I think I turned pale with amazement; 83 because the shade smiled and drew back, 84 and I, following her, pressed on further.

query.prompt:

85 Soavemente disse ch’io posasse; 86 allor conobbi chi era, e pregai 87 che, per parlarmi, un poco s’arrestasse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Rispuosemi: «Così com’ io t’amai 89 nel mortal corpo, così t’amo sciolta: 90 però m’arresto; ma tu perché vai?».
query.error: **English:** 88 She replied to me: "Just as I loved you 89 in your mortal body, so I love you now that you are free; 90 that is why I stop; but why are you going?"
query.result: 88 Hi a leveris dhe'm: "Kepar ha'm ow karas 89 y'n korf mortal, keth ow karas dibarthys: 90 rag ena y'm sevel; mes tysa, perag ow mos?''

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 «Casella mio, per tornar altra volta 92 là dov’ io son, fo io questo vïaggio», 93 diss’ io; «ma a te com’ è tanta ora tolta?».
query.error: **English:** 91 "Casella mine, I am making this journey 92 in order to return to the place where I am from," 93 I said; "but why have you been taken away for so long?"
query.result: 91 "Casella ow, rag dhe dhyski dhe'n fordh arall 92 dhe'n le ma y'm deuth, ow kovsa ow viaj ma," 93 ow leveris; "mes dhys, perag ow kovsa ow kemeras dhe'n fordh ma rag kemmys termyn?''

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Ed elli a me: «Nessun m’è fatto oltraggio, 95 se quei che leva quando e cui li piace, 96 più volte m’ha negato esto passaggio;

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 ché di giusto voler lo suo si face: 98 veramente da tre mesi elli ha tolto 99 chi ha voluto intrar, con tutta pace.

query.result: 97 rag ytho gwir dhe wul yma ytho gwres: 98 yn wir rag tri mis yma ytho kemerys 99 neb a vynnas mos, gans peth poos."

100 Ond’ io, ch’era ora a la marina vòlto 101 dove l’acqua di Tevero s’insala, 102 benignamente fu’ da lui ricolto.

query.result: 100 Ha my, a veu lemmyn dhe'n fordh-ma troys, 101 le may Tevero a wra dhe wulsa, 102 yn dhyner o henna y'm beu kemerys.

query.result: 103 Yn an fordh-ma na ytho henna lemmyn y esel dhe dhelergh, 104 rag hemma bys vyth ytho ytho kemerys 105 neb nyns yw mos dhe Acheron».

109 di ciò ti piaccia consolare alquanto 110 l’anima mia, che, con la sua persona 111 venendo qui, è affannata tanto!».
query.error: **English:** 109 may it please you to console with it somewhat 110 my soul, which, coming here with its body, 111 is so distressed!".
query.result: 109 ow henna owth owth plegya dhe lowena 110 ow enef, ow tos dhemmyn gans y gorf, 111 yw dhesempys kemmys!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 ‘Amor che ne la mente mi ragiona’ 113 cominciò elli allor sì dolcemente, 114 che la dolcezza ancor dentro mi suona.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Lo mio maestro e io e quella gente 116 ch’eran con lui parevan sì contenti, 117 come a nessun toccasse altro la mente.
query.error: **English:** 115 My master and I and those people 116 who were with him seemed so content, 117 as if nothing else touched their minds.
query.result: 115 Ow mester ha my ha'n dus ow thens 116 a veu gans henna kemmys lowen, 117 kepar dell ywth neb aral ow kovsa y'gan menow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Noi eravam tutti fissi e attenti 119 a le sue note; ed ecco il veglio onesto 120 gridando: «Che è ciò, spiriti lenti?
query.error: **English:** 118 We were all fixed and attentive 119 to his notes; and behold the venerable old man 120 crying out: "What is this, slow spirits?
query.result: 118 Ni o oll fisys ha prederys 119 dhe'y notys; ha wetho'n hen dhegwir 120 ow leverel: "Pyth yw henna, spyrys lent?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 qual negligenza, quale stare è questo? 122 Correte al monte a spogliarvi lo scoglio 123 ch’esser non lascia a voi Dio manifesto».

query.result: 121 Pyth esneges, pyth sevel yw henna? 122 Redya dhe'n menydh dhe spolya an garrek 123 na wra dalleth dheuch Duw dhe vos kler."

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

127 se cosa appare ond’ elli abbian paura, 128 subitamente lasciano star l’esca, 129 perch’ assaliti son da maggior cura;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 così vid’ io quella masnada fresca 131 lasciar lo canto, e fuggir ver’ la costa, 132 com’ om che va, né sa dove rïesca;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 né la nostra partita fu men tosta.
query.error: **English:** 133 and our departure was no less hasty.
query.result: 133 ha ny veu nyns moy tosta ny ayr owth ayr.
